definition[0]: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment
example[0]: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
example[1]: A public address system magnifies all the little noises and coughs.
definition[1]: to make something seem more important than it really is
example[2]: The report tends to magnify the risks involved.
definition[2]: to make something much worse or more serious
example[3]: The results of economic mismanagement were magnified by a series of natural disasters.
